headline: Gubernatorial candidate: 'Same guys lining their pockets' at Ohio statehouse
author: Bob Pepalis
sentences: “What we've seen at the statehouse for the past three decades is the same guys lining their pockets instead of taking care of the issues that I see in Dayton and cities all across the state from Zanesville to Portsmouth to Mount Vernon,” Whaley told the Mount Vernon News.

“Special-interest dealing at the statehouse is done, and we deserve better than what we've gotten.”
She grew up in a small town in Indiana, the daughter of a union autoworker and a mom who worked at a laundromat to help make ends meet.
Nan Whaley sees having the same people in charge at the Ohio capital for three decades as a source of the problem of corruption, and she wants to change that by running for governor.
“I think Pennsylvania and Michigan are eating our lunch when it comes to making the wind turbines and solar panels that will fuel this country in the future,” she said.
Elected officials with self-interest and special interests take care of themselves instead of taking care of families and communities in Ohio, Whaley said.
